member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.DataSetDataReader.BuildOrdinalMap(System.String)
member.summary: Begins the process of building the OrdinalMap which is stored in a hashtable with the ordinal value being the key. If the fieldName is a column in the main table, or a direct child relationship it is handled in this method; else it is pased on to the ParseFieldName method.
member.param: The full string name to be parsed (either column name, or child relationship off of the main table, or a nested set of parent relations with a final column).
member.returns: The key of the OrdinalMap for the fieldName in the ordinal hashtable.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.DataSetDataReader.ParseFieldName(System.String[],System.Int32,System.Data.DataRelation[],System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Recursive method that parses out the relationships from the column name and builds a map that can be traversed when calling GetValue
member.param: String array created by splitting the fieldName on "."
Current possition in the values array
current array of relations being collected by parsing the string
current table being examined for containing the column or relationship that is currently being examined in the values array at the specified position.
the orginal full field name passed into GetOrdinal. Used to return the full name when GetName is called
member.returns: The key of the OrdinalMap for the fieldName in the ordinal hashtable.

member.summary: Do nothing for the

member.summary: Returns an providing access to a related set of child records.
member.remarks: The GetData method only works if there is a direct child relationship with the working table.
member.param: An representing the ordinal value of the field being examined.
member.exception: An exception throws when is -1
An exception is thrown when, field with the index not found
An exception is thrown when, child relationship not found in table.

An exception is thrown when, field with the index not found
An exception is thrown when, field does not exist in the table

member.summary: This method that loops through the relationships in a map to get the value for the current row in the nested parent relationships
member.param: The row to use to get the parent relationships rows from.
The array of parent relatioships that was stored in the ordinal map.
member.returns: returns the final parent row after rolling through the relationships.

member.summary: Help determin the kind of ordinal map is being examined.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap
member.summary: The ordinal map is used to break down field names into a particular column in a table and the realtion(s) the column is attached to based off of the main table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap.#ctor(GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMapKind,System.Data.DataColumn,System.Data.DataRelation[],System.Data.DataRelation,System.String)
member.summary: Stores information on how to map to a particular field, child relationship or field contained in a parent realtionship(s).
member.param: Indicates what type of map it is (e.g fieldOnly - field in current table, fieldWithNestedRelations - field in a nested set of parent relationships
A for the field in the map
a containing the nested parent relationships for a field
a containting the parent relationship if the field is contained in a direct parent from the working table.
a matching the full string name passed in to GetOrdinal.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap.MapKind
member.summary: Indicates what type of map it is. e.g, only a field (FieldOnly), a field with nested relations (FieldWithNestedRelations), etc...

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap.Relation
member.summary: Used instead of the array if there is only one relationship in the name (e.g FK_Order_Details_Orders.OrderID)

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap.Column
member.summary: The particular column the field belongs to in its table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap.ChildRelations
member.summary: Used if there are nested relationships in the full field name. (e.g FK_Order_Details_Orders.FK_Orders_Customers.CompanyName) It's called childRealtions because in respect to the location of the field, the relations are children relationships of the table containing the field.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.DataSet.OrdinalMap.FullFieldName
member.summary: Stores the full field name that was passed in with GetOrdinal. Used with GetName.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMap
member.summary: The ordinal map is used to break down field names into a particular column in a table and the realtion(s) the column is attached to based off of the main table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMap.#ctor(GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMapKind,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo[],System.String)
member.summary: Stores information on how to map to a particular field, child relationship or field contained in a parent realtionship(s).
member.param: Indicates what type of map it is (e.g fieldOnly - field in current table, fieldWithNestedRelations - field in a nested set of parent relationships
The property info to store if it's a single level
The array of properties infos to store for multiple level refrences.
A matching the full string name passed in to GetOrdinal.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMap.MapKind
member.summary: Indicates what type of map it is. e.g, only a field (FieldOnly), a field with nested relations (FieldWithNestedRelations), etc...

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMap.Property
member.summary: Used instead of the array if there is only one relationship in the name (e.g FK_Order_Details_Orders.OrderID)

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMap.ChildProperties
member.summary: Used if there are nested relationships in the full field name. (e.g FK_Order_Details_Orders.FK_Orders_Customers.CompanyName) It's called childRealtions because in respect to the location of the field, the relations are children relationships of the table containing the field.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.ObjectDataSource.OrdinalMap.FullFieldName
member.summary: Stores the full field name that was passed in with GetOrdinal. Used with GetName.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.Testing.TestingDataReader.ParseHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the first line in the passed in command text string to create the field names and field data types. The field information is stored in a struct, and these column info items are stored in an ArrayList. The column name is also added to a hashtable for easy lookup later.
member.param: header string that contains all the fields.
member.returns: True if it can parse the header string, else false.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.Testing.TestingDataReader.ParseDataRow(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a row of data using a regular expression and stores the information inside an object array that is the current row of data. If the row does not have the correct number of fields, an exception is raised.
member.param: String value representing a comma delimited data row
member.returns: True if it can parse the data string, else false.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.BI.Data.DataProviders.Testing.TestingDataReader.ConvertValue(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Coverts the string value coming from the command text to the appropriate data type, based off of the field's type. This also checks a few string value rules to decide if a String.Empty of System.Data.DBNull needs to be returned.
member.param: Type of the current column the data belongs to.
String value coming from the command text.
member.returns: Resulting object from the converted string, based off of the type.
